cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to turn westward skirting the Louisiana shoreline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Plaquemines Parish/Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coastline from Morgan City eastward through Plaquemines Parish to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds 40–55 mph with higher gusts are expected Monday afternoon through late evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along Plaquemines Parish tidal coast and lower Mississippi River Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches, producing a flash-flood threat.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the possibility of a few tornadoes.
